DOC.brief_summary: Interscalene brachial plexus block provide excellent time limited analgesia . Intravenous dexamethasone increase analgesic duration single-shot interscalene block ropivacaine shoulder arthroscopic surgery . We want evaluate effect two different dos ( dexamethasone 10 mg i.v . v 4 mg i.v . vs placebo ) analgesic duration single-shot inter scalene block . Our study hypothesis dexamethasone 4 mg i.v . equivalent dexamethasone10 mg i.v . prolong analgesic duration single-shot interscalene block ropivacaine .
DOC.brief_title: Intravenous Dexamethasone Increase Analgesic Duration Interscalene Block
DOC.detailed_description: 75 patient randomly assign three group : - D10 : dexamethasone 10 mg I.V . dilute normal saline 20cc , immediately inter scalene block - D4 : dexamethasone 4 mg I.V . dilute normal saline 20cc , immediately inter scalene block - C : control : Normal saline 20cc I.V. , immediately inter scalene block . These patient recruit 3 hospital , two surgeon perform surgery . All patient surgery regional anesthesia provide inter scalene plexus block , ropivacaine 0.5 % 20cc . In postoperative period , patient give analgesic medication need basis . They instruct take first analgesic medication postoperative shoulder pain reach > 3/10 . They note time day outcome occurs .
